title: aoluain
author: aoluain
created_time: July 07, 2023, 12:32:48 PMLast edit: July 26, 2023, 11:05:58 AM by aoluain
content: Just wondering if there is an appetite for running a raffle for a copy of the "Bitcoin Day" Diario el Salvador newspaper?This has been stored with zero exposure to light, which is the number 1 enemy of newsprint paper.It has been covered with 160gsm black acid free paper in a grip sealed bag.I'm thinking 12 slots at BTC0.0005 per slot which includes registered delivery.If you are interested you can claim your slot, no need to send payment until all slotsare filled.After slots are filled a block will be chosen, the last digit of that block will determinethe winner.

comments.author: aoluain
comments.created_time: July 07, 2023, 12:33:49 PMLast edit: July 09, 2023, 06:48:57 AM by aoluain
comments.body: I'll run this for lets say 2 weeks max or until all slots are filled. If they are not filled I will reconsider.12345 - 2Pizza410000BTC6789abc

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: Is this a well known Bitcoin-collectible newspaper? Not familiar with it, can you elaborate a little bit because I cannot read the date of release on the photo you posted. Thank you.Did you intend for this raffel to have only 12 instead of the usual 16 slots (HEX)?

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Quote from: Kryptowerk on July 08, 2023, 05:45:09 PMIs this a well known Bitcoin-collectible newspaper? Not familiar with it, can you elaborate a little bit because I cannot read the date of release on the photo you posted. Thank you.Did you intend for this raffel to have only 12 instead of the usual 16 slots (HEX)? I have seen a few for sale on ebay like this one https://www.ebay.com/itm/384449222302but no expert on these lol

comments.author: aoluain
comments.body: Quote from: owlcatz on July 09, 2023, 02:52:50 AMQuote from: Kryptowerk on July 08, 2023, 05:45:09 PMIs this a well known Bitcoin-collectible newspaper? Not familiar with it, can you elaborate a little bit because I cannot read the date of release on the photo you posted. Thank you.Did you intend for this raffel to have only 12 instead of the usual 16 slots (HEX)? I have seen a few for sale on ebay like this one https://www.ebay.com/itm/384449222302but no expert on these lol yes, or like this one below which I suppose can be referred to as #2 > https://scarce.city/auctions/La-Ley-Bitcoin-2There are 4 "collectible" editions:1 - El Salvador announces its plans to make Bitcoin legal 6th June 20212 - The El Salvador assembly approves Bitcoin to be legal tender ¬†9th June 20213 - The Day Bitcoin "went live" in El Salvador 7th September 20214 - Plans to make a dedicated Bitcoin City 21st November 2021Mopar had a full set for auction not too long ago which didnt sell > https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5443667.msg61864123#msg61864123So I dont think a lot of people realise the collectability of these and how hard they areto assemble all 4 editions, I think edition #2 is the rarest the one I dont have!

comments.author: aoluain
comments.created_time: July 16, 2023, 05:53:16 AMLast edit: July 16, 2023, 06:03:20 AM by aoluain
comments.body: Rolling this for another week to see if there are any more ticket takers.If I get close to the 12 or possibly even half the tickets sold I might still proceed andrun the raffle... which increases everyones chance to win !!!The only caveat to this is that I would like to 50% of the postage cost from the winner üôè(thats ‚Ç¨12 to US and ‚Ç¨8 to EU ) this can be negotiated though.

comments.author: aoluain
comments.body: Bumping again to see if there is any more interested in boking a ticket.Tracked postage included in the ticket price if all 12 are sold
